title: Friday preview: Pearson expected to report flat first half earnings after selling FT
text:
806.40 -7.10 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - Pearson (Xetra: 858266 - news ) on Friday reports its first quarter interims after confirming it has sold the Financial Times Group to Nikkei for £844m. Japan's largest media company will take on the FT Group, which publishes the iconic Financial Times, after Pearson spent a few weeks exploring the sale. Atif Latif, director of trading at Guardian Stockbrokers , said if the transaction would be a "positive move for Pearson even though they would be selling a strong asset and brand". 
Numis has predicted Pearson would reveal broadly flat first-half underlying growth on the back of revenues of £2.17bn, adjusted operating profit of £103m and adjusted pre-tax profit of £67m. 
"Our first half profit represents just 9% of the full year," said analyst Gareth Davis in a note published on Thursday before Pearson announced its sale of the FT Group. 
"We remain comfortable with our 'reduce' recommendation into this set of results."
